item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes people are beautiful. Not in looks. Not in what they say. Just in what they are." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I have hated words and I have loved them, and I hope I have made them right." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "It kills me sometimes, how people die." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I am haunted by humans." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "She leaned down and looked at his lifeless face and Leisel kissed her best friend, Rudy Steiner, soft and true on his lips. He tasted dusty and sweet. He tasted like regret in the shadows of trees and in the glow of the anarchist's suit collection. She kissed him long and soft, and when she pulled herself away, she touched his mouth with her fingers...She did not say goodbye. She was incapable, and after a few more minutes at his side, she was able to tear herself from the ground. It amazes me what humans can do, even when streams are flowing down their faces and they stagger on..." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "He does something to me, that boy. Every time. It’s his only detriment. He steps on my heart. He makes me cry." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description:
"How about a kiss, <i>Saumensch</i>?"
He stood waist-deep in the water for a few moments longer before climbing out and handing her the book. His pants clung to him, and he did not stop walking. In truth, I think he was afraid. Rudy Steiner was scared of the book thief's kiss. He must have longed for it so much. He must have loved her so incredibly hard. So hard that he would never ask for her lips again and would go to his grave without them." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description:
"It’s a small story really, about, among other things:
* A girl * Some words * An accordionist * Some fanatical Germans * A Jewish fist fighter * And quite a lot of thievery" -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Believe it or not--it takes a lot of love to hate you like this." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I'm not the messenger at all. I'm the message. " -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "You can kill a man with those words. No gun. No bullets. Just words and a girl." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I'm just another stupid human." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "My full name's Ed Kennedy. I'm nineteen. I'm an underage cab driver. I'm typical of many of the young men you see in this suburban outpost of the city -- not a whole lot of prospects or possibility. That aside, I read more books than I should, and I'm decidedly crap at sex and doing my taxes. Nice to meet you. " -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "When her hands reached out and poured the tea, it was as if she also poured something into me while I sat there sweating in my cab. It was like she held a string and pulled on it just slightly to open me up. She got in, put a piece of herself inside me, and left again." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "It's funny, don't you think, how time seems to do a lot of things? It flies, it tells, and worst of all, it runs out." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "My arms are killing me. I didn't know words could be so heavy." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description:
"She looks at the swings, and I can see she’s imagining what they’d look like if the kids weren’t there. The guilt of this holds her down momentarily. It appears to be there constantly. Never far away, despite her love for them.
I realize that nothing belongs to her anymore and she belongs to everything." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description:
"Possibly the only good to come out of these nightmares was that it brought Hans Hubermann, her new papa, into the room, to soothe her, to love her.
He came every night and sat with her. The first couple of times, he simply stayed - a stranger to kill the aloneness. A few nights after that, he whispered, "Shhh, I'm here, it's all right." After three weeks he held her. Trust was accumulated quickly, due primarily to the brute strength of the man's gentleness, his thereness. The girl knew from the outset that Hans Hubermann would always appear midscream, and he would not leave. (36)" -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I want to talk to him. I want to ask him about that girl and if he loved her and still misses her. Nothing, however, exits my mouth. How well do we really let ourselves know each other? There's a long quietness until I finally break it open. It reminds me of someone breaking bread and handing it out. In my case, I hand out a question to my friend." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "You want to know what I truly look like? I'll help you out. find yourself a mirror while I continue." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "She soon says, "You're my best friend, Ed." You can kill a man with those words. No gun. No bullets. Just words and a girl." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Christina add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Christina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Christina add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Christina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Christina add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Christina add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.
